page.title: 02Marchwood Parish Church
page.content: {St.John's Church Marchwood was built in 1842 by a Mr.Holloway, who owned the big house at Marchwood Park.About 60 baptisms, 20 funerals and 15 weddings take place each year.On Sunday about 60 people usually go to morning services and a Sunday school is held for children as well.The church choir also performs concerts throughout the year. The outside of the church is beginning ot look rather shabby as it hasn't been decorated for over 7 years.The present vicar thinks that the church is too big. Just outside the church is a memorial to those killed on the Royal Fleet Auxiliary ship 'Sir Galahad' in the Falklands War. The ship was based at the Marchwood Army Port.
